title: Here's a list of 20 articles on commonsense reasoning in natural language processing (NLP) up to 2020. These papers cover various aspects of integrating commonsense knowledge into NLP models, benchmarks, and applications
**"Commonsense Knowledge and Commonsense Reasoning: An Overview"** by Ernest Davis and Gary Marcus
A comprehensive overview of commonsense knowledge and reasoning in AI
**"ConceptNet 5: A Large Semantic Network for Relational Knowledge"** by Robyn Speer and Catherine Havasi
Discusses ConceptNet, a semantic network designed to help computers understand commonsense knowledge
Commonsense Transformers for Automatic Knowledge Graph Construction"** by Antoine Bosselut et al
Introduces COMET, a model that generates commonsense knowledge using transformers
**"SWAG: A Large-Scale Adversarial Dataset for Grounded Commonsense Inference"** by Rowan Zellers et al
Presents SWAG, a dataset for evaluating grounded commonsense inference
**"CommonsenseQA: A Question Answering Challenge Targeting Commonsense Knowledge"** by Alon Talmor et al
Introduces CommonsenseQA, a dataset for evaluating commonsense reasoning in QA systems
**"Social IQa: Commonsense Reasoning about Social Interactions"** by Maarten Sap et al
Proposes Social IQa, a benchmark for evaluating social commonsense reasoning
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
While not solely focused on commonsense, BERT has been foundational in NLP, including commonsense tasks
**"RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach"** by Yinhan Liu et al
An optimized version of BERT that has been used in commonsense reasoning tasks
Analyzing the Knowledge of Language Models"** by Fabio Petroni et al
Analyzes the factual and commonsense knowledge captured by language models
**"Zero-Shot Text Classification with Generative Language Models"** by Yinfei Yang et al
Explores zero-shot learning for text classification, relevant for commonsense reasoning
Introduces a challenge for evaluating commonsense reasoning in AI
Discusses approaches to solving the Winograd Schema Challenge using machine reading comprehension
**"Reasoning about Actions and State Changes by Injecting Commonsense Knowledge"** by Nasrin Mostafazadeh et al
Explores the use of commonsense knowledge in reasoning about actions and state changes
**"Story Cloze Test: A New Benchmark for Story Understanding and Generation"** by Nasrin Mostafazadeh et al
Introduces a benchmark for evaluating story understanding, involving commonsense reasoning
**"Event2Mind: Commonsense Inference on Events, Intents, and Reactions"** by Hannah Rashkin et al
Proposes a model for inferring commonsense knowledge about events, intents, and reactions
**"OpenAI GPT: Generative Pre-trained Transformer"** by Alec Radford et al
Discusses the GPT model, which has been used for various commonsense reasoning tasks
**"Knowledge-Enhanced Contextual Word Representations"** by Kenton Lee et al
Explores enhancing word representations with knowledge for improved commonsense reasoning
**"Probing Neural Network Comprehension of Natural Language Arguments"** by Ellie Pavlick and Tom Kwiatkowski
Investigates how well neural networks understand natural language arguments, including commonsense reasoning
**"Commonsense Knowledge Mining from Pretrained Models"** by Yao Fu et al
Discusses methods for extracting commonsense knowledge from pretrained language models
**"ALBERT: A Lite BERT for Self-supervised Learning of Language Representations"** by Zhenzhong Lan et al
Introduces ALBERT, a model that has been applied to commonsense reasoning tasks
These articles provide a solid foundation for understanding the development and application of commonsense reasoning in NLP up to
